Class Basket

java.lang.Object
homeappliance.Basket
public class Basket extends Object
The Basket class is for managing ApplianceItem objects and their quantities. This class provides functionalities to add items, remove items, retrieve the current basket contents, calculate the total price, and clear the basket.
Version:
5/1/2025
Author:
Amrit Singh

  • Constructor Details

    • Basket

      public Basket()
      Default constructor for Basket. Initialises a new instance of the class without any additional setup.

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem(ApplianceItem item)
      Adds an ApplianceItem to the basket. If the item already exists in the basket, its quantity is incremented by 1.
      Parameters:
      item - the ApplianceItem to add to the basket

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem(int itemId)
      Removes one instance of an ApplianceItem from the basket based on its ID. If the item's quantity is greater than 1, it decrements the quantity by 1. Otherwise, it removes the item from the basket entirely. If the item is not found in the basket, an informational message is displayed.
      Parameters:
      itemId - the ID of the ApplianceItem to remove

    • getItemsWithQuantities

      public Map<ApplianceItem,Integer> getItemsWithQuantities()
      Retrieves a map of all items in the basket along with their quantities.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are ApplianceItem objects and the values are their quantities

    • getTotalPrice

      public int getTotalPrice()
      Calculates the total price of all items in the basket. The total price is determined by summing the price of each item multiplied by its quantity.
      Returns:
      the total price of items in the basket

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all items from the basket, effectively resetting it to an empty state.
